anime.description: Since ancient times shrine maidens who wield swords have been exorcising "http://anidb.net/t7100 [aradama]," strange existences that threaten the human world. These young women who wear school uniforms and a sword are called "http://anidb.net/t7097 [Toji]," and they serve as an official unit within the police force as a "http://anidb.net/ch95215 [special religious service police squad]." The government authorizes the Toji to wear swords and serve as government officials, and the government has set up five schools throughout the country for the girls to attend. The girls live ordinary school lives, while occasionally performing their duties, wielding their swords and using various powers to fight and protect the people. In the spring, the five schools send their best Toji to compete in a tournament. As the tournament comes closer, all of the representatives rigorously train themselves in order to get stronger and improve their skills. Source: ANN Note: The first episode received an early screening at a special event held at Kadokawa Cinema Shinjuku on 24.12.2017.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: countryside
tag.description: The anime takes place far from the any densely populated areas like cities, i.e. out in the suburbs, in the countryside with many fields and forests.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: alternative present
tag.description: Anime that fit in the alternative present category usually have technology and society that is very similar to ours, but with differences in both, history and culture, which sometimes are blatantly obvious, but sometimes harder to place; this one can at times be very subjective.

tag.name: power suit
tag.description: Power Suits are similar to Piloted Robots which are controlled from inside the robot except that Power Suits tend to be more directly tied to how the character moves and they are usually not as big as Piloted Robots can be. They are still mechanical and shouldn`t be confused with plug suits.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Kyoto
tag.description: Kyoto Prefecture is a prefecture of Japan in the Kansai region of the island of Honshu. The capital is the city of Kyoto. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: parasite
tag.description: Parasites are life forms that feed off other beings in some way. In anime, they are often aliens and usually intelligent. For shock value, and to avoid having to draw aliens all the time, their prey is preferably human; they may see humans as food, as puppets for mind control, or simply as temporary body hosts. In every case, the human is the victim of a "merging", which is not to be confused with the more "amicable" symbiosis.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: revenge
tag.description: A primary factor that drives the plot forward, is the almost obsessive desire of one of the characters to get back at someone else.

tag.name: conspiracy
tag.description: The conspiracy thriller (or paranoid thriller) is a sub-genre of the thriller which flourished in the 1970s in the US (and was echoed in other parts of the world) in the wake of a number of high-profile scandals and controversies (most notably Vietnam, the assassination of President Kennedy, Chappaquiddick and Watergate), and which exposed what many people regarded as the clandestine machinations and conspiracies beneath the orderly fabric of political life. The protagonists of conspiracy thrillers are often journalists or amateur investigators who find themselves (often inadvertently) pulling on a small thread which unravels a vast conspiracy that ultimately goes "all the way to the top".

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: body sharing
tag.description: A character shares the same body with another entity. Usually this is due to a secret/hidden identity either due to DNA/blood, a ritual, an item or some freak accident. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t3663 [body snatcher].

tag.name: Tokyo Skytree
tag.description: Tokyo Skytree is a broadcasting, restaurant, and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo, Japan. It became the tallest structure in Japan in 2010 and reached its full height of 634.0 metres in March 2011, making it the tallest tower in the world, displacing the Canton Tower, and the second tallest structure in the world after Burj Khalifa (829.8 m). Source: Wikipedia Note: Not to be confused with the very much older http://anidb.net/t3667 [Tokyo Tower].

tag.name: ohanami
tag.description: Hanami (花見, lit. "flower viewing") is the Japanese traditional custom of enjoying the beauty of flowers, "flower" in this case almost always meaning cherry blossoms or ume blossoms. From the end of March to early May, sakura bloom all over Japan, and around the first of February on the island of Okinawa. The blossom forecast (桜前線 sakurazensen, literally cherry blossom front) is announced each year by the weather bureau, and is watched carefully by those planning hanami as the blossoms only last a week or two. In modern-day Japan, hanami mostly consists of having an outdoor party beneath the sakura during daytime or at night. Hanami at night is called yozakura (夜桜, literally night sakura). (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: plot twists
tag.description: The plot and story of this anime may seem to be going along a quite predictable path, when suddenly there is a jarring unexpected twist in the plot, taking the viewer by surprise.

tag.name: fate
tag.description: Fate — The predestined path of all things. The outcome is inevitable and the consequences predetermined. Whether or not the protagonist ultimately decides to follow this path shall weigh heavily on their soul.

tag.name: human experimentation
tag.description: Genetic, biological, chemical or psychological experimentation on human beings are portrayed or their aftermath is shown.

tag.name: body takeover
tag.description: A person`s body is taken over by some foreign intelligence. It`s not brainwashing, because they still have control of their own mind — but that`s all they have. Either they`ve been reduced to a spectator in their own body, or their soul has been booted out of their body entirely. Either way, the rest of the cast will soon find he`s not himself.

tag.name: teamwork
tag.description: A cooperative effort by the members of a group or team to achieve a common goal.

tag.name: winter
tag.description: Coldest season of the year with ice and snow, everything is covered in a blanket of white.

tag.name: saving the world
tag.description: While villains love to take over the world or cause the end of the world as we know it, the heroes are most likely motivated by the polar opposite, saving the world. A fairly simple plot/motivation related to for great justice and what not, this trope is pretty broad and very common for many stories not focused on character interaction only. Source: TV Trope

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: science and magic coexist
tag.description: In this anime science and magic do not exclude each other. Magic here is actually very advanced, artefact- and/or ritual-based science.

tag.name: in medias res
tag.description: In medias res, also medias in res (Latin for "into the midst of affairs (lit. into mid-affairs)"), refers to a literary and artistic technique where the narrative starts in the middle of the story instead of from its beginning. It is generally a plot-driven concept rather than a character-driven one; though characters are commonly used to provide the backstory. The characters, setting, and conflict are often introduced through a series of flashbacks or through characters relating past events to each other. Probably originating from an oral tradition, the technique is a convention of epic poetry, one of the earliest and most prominent examples in Western literature being Homer`s Odyssey and Iliad. Virgil`s Aeneid began the tradition in literature of imitating Homer, continued in Torquato Tasso`s Jerusalem Delivered, John Milton`s Paradise Lost and "Inferno" from Dante`s Divine Comedy. George Lucas`s Star Wars saga was told using in medias res.

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: improbable physics
tag.description: The physics in this anime have little to do with real-world physics, and are actually very much exaggerated. Examples: Cars hitting a tiny obstacle, but then flying through the air for no apparent reason, or flimsy bullets slamming heavy characters clear across the room.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: children of destiny
tag.description: In case of nearing doomsday leave all the military equipment to kids — they will save the day. Rejoice!

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: nearly almighty protagonist
tag.description: Man 1: "Hey man, did you see me take down that guy over there, there`s no way he could have survived that!" Man 2: "Yeah I know what you mean, it would take the strength of 1 million men to be able to ..... HE`S GETTING BACK UP!!?!?" *synonymous jaws dropping* This anime`s main character is comparable to the gods themselves in terms of resistibility, strength and/or downright bad-assery. Whenever they seem as if the fire inside has burnt out, they rise from the ashes with enough tenacity and ferocity to vanquish any foe that dare stand against them.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: adults are useless
tag.description: For when adults can`t do anything right.

tag.name: military is useless
tag.description: The regular military force per se or certain units thereof are way out of their league when trying to take on the usually vastly superior foes (e.g. powerful aliens). Thus the regular military is completely useless. Often, only children (of all people) with special abilities and/or powered suits can defend Earth.

tag.name: secret organisation
tag.description: A secret organisation or secret society is an organisation whose activities and inner functioning are concealed from non-members. The society may or may not attempt to conceal its existence itself. Examples of historical and existing secret societies include Freemasonry, the Knights Templar, the Rosicrucians, Skull and Bones, the Thule Society, and the Illuminati.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: end of the world
tag.description: The imminent end of the world may range from the total destruction of the planet Earth, to the destruction of Earth`s surface, or to the point where human life on the planet is no longer possible, aka the end of humanity. In any case it looks grim, and the protagonists battle to preserve what they can.

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: season
tag.description: A season is a division of the year, marked by changes in weather, ecology, and hours of daylight. Seasons result from the yearly orbit of the Earth around the Sun and the tilt of the Earth`s rotational axis relative to the plane of the orbit. In temperate and polar regions, the seasons are marked by changes in the intensity of sunlight that reaches the Earth`s surface, variations of which may cause animals to go into hibernation or to migrate, and plants to be dormant. During May, June, and July, the northern hemisphere is exposed to more direct sunlight because the hemisphere faces the sun. The same is true of the southern hemisphere in November, December, and January. It is the tilt of the Earth that causes the Sun to be higher in the sky during the summer months which increases the solar flux. However, due to seasonal lag, June, July, and August are the hottest months in the northern hemisphere and December, January, and February are the hottest months in the southern hemisphere. In temperate and subpolar regions, four calendar-based seasons (with their adjectives) are generally recognized: spring (vernal), summer (estival), autumn (autumnal), fall and winter (hibernal). Ecologists often use a six-season model for temperate climate regions that includes pre-spring (prevernal) and late summer (serotinal) as distinct seasons along with the traditional four. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: spring
tag.description: During spring, the axis of the Earth is increasing its tilt relative to the Sun, and the length of daylight rapidly increases for the relevant hemisphere. The hemisphere begins to warm significantly causing new plant growth to spring forth, giving the season its name. Snow, if a normal part of winter, begins to melt, and streams swell with runoff. Frosts, if a normal part of winter, become less severe. In climates that have no snow and rare frosts, the air and ground temperatures increase more rapidly. Many flowering plants bloom this time of year, in a long succession sometimes beginning when snow is still on the ground, continuing into early summer. In normally snowless areas spring may begin as early as February (Northern Hemisphere) heralded by the blooming of deciduous magnolias, cherries and quince, or August (Southern Hemisphere) in the same way. Many temperate areas have a dry spring, and wet autumn (fall), which brings about flowering in this season more consistent with the need for water as well as warmth. Subarctic areas may not experience spring at all until May or even June. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: body and host
tag.description: When a foreign entity like that of a symbiote, body snatcher, puppeteer parasite, or even a hacker (when regarding machines like robots and computers) enters/outright hijacks a body, the possessed subject becomes what is usually called: the host. The basic purpose of the host varies on what the point was for it to have been hijacked in the first place. Sometimes it`s used as a disguise, other times it`s used as a decoy and destraction, even simply being used as a weapon and piece of armor that the possessor uses to cause sheer chaos and destruction, but sometimes... a host can be used for fetish fuel.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Minoseki Gakuin
character.description: The Minoseki Academy is one of the schools affiliated to the http://anidb.net/ch95156 [Five Traditions], located in Gifu prefecture. Their jurisdiction covers the whole Chubu region and the Sea of Japan side of Eastern Japan. The school has a positive interaction with the four other schools under the Five Traditions. The school is led by Academy President http://anidb.net/ch94795 [Hashima Ema]. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Asakura Mihono
character.description: Asakura Mihono is a middle school student of http://anidb.net/ch95147 [Minoseki Academy]. Her okatana is Kashuu Kiyomitsu.

character.name: Heijou Gakkan
character.description: The Heijou Institute is a school affiliated with the http://anidb.net/ch95156 [Five Traditions], located in Nara prefecture. Heijou handles http://anidb.net/t7100 [aradama] incidents that take place in the Shikoku region and the southern part of Kansai region. Notably, the school has created many excellent http://anidb.net/t7097 [toji] and http://anidb.net/ch90628 [Shidou Maki], currently the two-time Kenjutsu Tournament champion, graduated from Heijou. The school is led by President http://anidb.net/ch94796 [Gojou Iroha]. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Osafune Jogakuen
character.description: The Osafune Girls` Academy is one of the schools affiliated with the http://anidb.net/ch95156 [Five Traditions], located in Okayama prefecture. The school responds to http://anidb.net/t7100 [aradama] incidents in the Chugoku region, Kyushu and Okinawa. Within Osafune`s jurisdiction is the organization on developing the latest technology, making it active in assisting other schools through the use and testing of experimental equipment. The school is led by Academy President http://anidb.net/ch94798 [Maniwa Sana]. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Renpu Jogakuin
character.description: The Renpu Girls` School is one of the five schools consisting the http://anidb.net/ch95156 [Five Traditions], located in Kanagawa prefecture. Renpu responds to http://anidb.net/t7100 [aradama] threats that occur in the Kanto region and parts of Eastern Tokyo on the Pacific Ocean side. Both the http://anidb.net/ch95155 [Special Sword Administration Bureau]`s headquarters and the http://anidb.net/ch95153 [Origami family] is located within the jurisdiction of Renpu, allowing the two institutions to coordinate together. Because of their responsibilities in the Tokyo area which has seen a rise in incident frequency, both equipment and more of Renpu`s students are deployed recently. The school is led by President http://anidb.net/ch94797 [Takatsu Yukina]. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Ayanokouji Bugei Gakusha
character.description: The Ayanokouji Martial Arts School is a school affiliated to the http://anidb.net/ch95156 [Five Traditions], located in Kyoto prefecture. The school`s jurisdiction covers the remaining of the Kansai region not under http://anidb.net/ch95149 [Heijou Institute]`s responsibility. Despite being part of the Five Traditions, Ayanokouji stands as a traditional school with a lot of history, with http://anidb.net/t7097 [toji] from Ayanokouji treated with great respect. In times of emergency, the http://anidb.net/ch95155 [Special Sword Administration Bureau] can assume the school as a temporary headquarters. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Origami-ke
character.description: The Origami Family is a family entrusted with the management of noro produced in the creation of http://anidb.net/t7101 [okatana]. The family`s role traces back to the ancient times where they served a similar role in the Imperial Court, and continues to the present time, where the current head of the family also acts as the chief of the http://anidb.net/ch95155 [Special Sword Administration Bureau]. All of the current top-ranking http://anidb.net/t7097 [toji] serve managing roles in toji training institutions, also called the http://anidb.net/ch95156 [Five Traditions]. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Origami-ke Shineitai
character.description: Consisting of selected top-ranking http://anidb.net/t7097 [toji] in the present times, the Elite Guard serves the primary role of enacting orders from and assisting in the duties of the http://anidb.net/ch90627 [head] of the http://anidb.net/ch95153 [Origami Family], as well as acting as the protectors of the family head. Members of the Elite Guard no longer wear the uniform of their respective almae matres. Instead, they wear a brown military-style uniform consisting of a white pinstripe dress shirt, a brown double-breasted suit with short sleeves and light brown trim, and a pleated skirt. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Tokubetsu Touken-Rui Kanrikyoku
character.description: The Special Sword Administration Bureau is a Japanese government office affiliated with the National Police Agency that serves to oversee and regulate the actions of http://anidb.net/t7097 [toji] and organize operations against http://anidb.net/t7100 [aradama]. The bureau is currently led by Commander http://anidb.net/ch90627 [Origami Yukari], and its headquarters is located at Kamakura City. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Gokaden
character.description: The Five Traditions is an institution consisting of five middle-to-high schools established throughout Japan that focus on training special practical skills in occupational swordsmanship. The schools are under the jurisdiction of the http://anidb.net/ch95155 [Special Sword Administration Bureau], where there are not only http://anidb.net/t7097 [toji], but also personnel who are trained to assist in activities done by toji. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Etou Minato
character.description: Etou Minato was a former toji and student of http://anidb.net/ch95151 [Renpu Girls` School]. She was an active toji during the Great Disaster of Sagami Bay, however, much about her career as a toji was put aside when her official records were removed due to unknown reasons. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Juujou Kagari
character.description: Juujou Kagari was a former toji affiliated with the Special Ritual Riot Squad who fought during the Great Disaster of Sagami Bay. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Mokusa
character.description: The Mokusa is an organization that opposes http://anidb.net/ch90627 [Origami Yukari], which is regarded as a revisionist, and aims to restore the role of http://anidb.net/t7101 [okatana] and http://anidb.net/t7097 [toji]. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Tagitsuhime
character.description: Tagitsuhime is a sentient http://anidb.net/t7100 [aradama] popularly known as the Great Aradama that emerged and destroyed parts of Sagami Bay and Enoshima in an incident known as the Great Disaster of Sagami Bay. Its existence was caused by the agglomeration of massive amounts of noro stored in an American oil tanker bound for the United States, and has currently appeared twice in two large-scale aradama-related incidents. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Tokubetsu Saishi Kidoutai
character.description: The Special Ritual Riot Squad is a military force belonging to the http://anidb.net/ch95155 [Special Sword Administration Bureau] of the National Police Agency. They wield the special swords known as the http://anidb.net/t7101 [okatana] and have permission to use them at their own discretion. They hold a special position in government service, and a lot of them are females that haven`t yet reached adulthood. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Musumi Kiyoka
character.description: Musumi Kiyoka is a second-year middle school student of http://anidb.net/ch95149 [Heijou Institute]. Her http://anidb.net/t7101 [okatana] is Renge Fudou Teruhiro. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Shichinosato Kofuki
character.description: Shichinosato Kofuki is a third-year middle school student of http://anidb.net/ch95151 [Renpu Girls` School]. Her http://anidb.net/t7101 [okatana] are Chutan Nakiri and Niou Kiyotsuna. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

character.name: Kitora Miruya
character.description: Kitora Miruya is a half-Japanese half-Scandinavian second-year high school student of http://anidb.net/ch95152 [Ayanokouji Martial Arts School]. Her http://anidb.net/t7101 [okatana] is Jikkyuu Mitsutada. Source: Toji no Miko Wiki

episode.title: 切っ先の向く先
The Point of a Sword
La voie désignée par le sabre
Kissaki no Muku Saki
episode.summary: Etou Kanami, who won Minoseki Academy`s selection match is off to Kamakura with her best friend, Yanase Mai to compete in the elite tournament held by the illustrious Origami family. With skilled representatives from each of the five schools gathered for the tournament, these Toji in training put their skills to the test. Step forward competitors, the tournament is about to begin! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 覚悟の重さ
The Burden of Resolution
Le poids de la résolution
Kakugo no Omosa
episode.summary: After releasing Sayaka, Kanami and Hiyori part ways with Rui and agree to meet with the mysterious online presence, "FineMan," in Izu. Meanwhile, back in Kamakura, Kohagura Ellen and Mashiko Kaoru are ordered by the president of Osafune Girls` School to go after Hiyori and Kanami, but where do their loyalties truly lie? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無想の剣
Innocent Sword
Une Lame dépourvue d`âme
Musou no Ken
episode.summary: Kanami and Hiyori are taken in and given a place to stay by a former Minoseki Toji named Onda Rui. The girls are able to slow down and consider their next move. They realize their enemy might be a much greater force than they thought and just as things look bleak, Rui introduces the girls to someone else willing to help them in their struggle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人の距離
The Distance Between Them
Distance
Futari no Kyori
episode.summary: After her attempt to assassinate Origami Yukari fails, Hiyori is able to escape with Kanami`s aid. Meanwhile, there is much confusion back at the tournament over this unprecedented incident on the head of the Origami family. The school presidents are called in and a manhunt for the fugitive Toji students commences. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 災厄の日
Day of Disaster
Le jour de la catastrophe
Saiyaku no Hi
episode.summary: Kanami and the others arrive at Mokusa`s headquarters and meet with Origami Yukari`s younger sister, Akane. The girls learn the truth of the Great Disaster of Sagami Bay that occurred 20 years ago from her and Friedman. The truth of that day is vastly different from what the young Toji have been taught in school. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心の疼き
Heart Ache
Lancinement du cœur
Kokoro no Uzuki
episode.summary: Hiyori and Kanami are finally introduced to FineMan the Mokusa organization after escaping on a Mokusa submarine. Meanwhile, in Renpu, Yukina tries to force Sayaka to be injected with aradama, but Sayaka suddenly refuses and runs away. Mai comes to Sayaka`s rescue but the girls are pursued and attacked by Yume and find themselves escaping into Mokusa`s protection. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人と穢れの狭間
The Space Between Humans and Disgrace
L`interstice entre humains et Souillures
Hito to Kegare no Hazama
episode.summary: Having been captured by the elite guard Ellen is submitted to interrogation by Suzuka at their temporary command post. Meanwhile, Kaoru manages to rejoin Kanami and Hiyori with the intentions of taking them to their organization`s headquarters, but without Ellen the girls press Kaoru for more information. Ellen takes advantage of her captivity to investigate the elite guard`s secrets. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 山狩りの夜
A Night of Mountain Hunting
La nuit de la chasse
Yamagari no Yoru
episode.summary: Ellen and Kaoru once again catch up with Kanami and Hiyori, only this time they say they wish to test them. Upon passing the test, Ellen and Kaoru reveal themselves to be members of a secret organization that is resisting Origami Yukari. However, the girls are suddenly attacked by three of the members of Yukari`s elite guard and the secret behind their indomitable strength becomes horrifically apparent. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ひとつの太刀
A Single Sword
Technique ultime
Hitotsu no Tachi
episode.summary: Successfully overcoming both Maki and Suzuka, Kanami and Hiyori finally square off against Yukari. They are both driven into a corner when faced with her overwhelming power. Inheriting their mothers` wills, the girls make one last desperate stand to bring an end to Yukari and Princess Tagitsu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 月下の閃き
Gleam of Moonlight
Éclair sous le clair de lune
Gekka no Hirameki
episode.summary: Using the S equipment container, Kanami and the others break into the Origami mansion and make their way to the inner shrine in order to take down Origami Yukari. With the time limit on the S equipment running out, the elite guard stands in the girls` way. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明日への決意
Resolve for Tomorrow
Détermination pour l`avenir
Ashita e no Ketsui
episode.summary: The Origami family moves quickly, investigating Osafune Girls` School and Minoseki Academy under the suspicion of their participation in large-scale terrorist attacks. With Mokusa`s headquarters attacked and on the brink of total destruction, the girls once again reaffirm their resolve. With Akane and Friedman`s assistance the girls launch a desperate plan in order to take Origami Yukari down once and for all. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 祭りのあと
After the Festival
Après le festival
Matsuri no Ato
episode.summary: Upon learning the truth of their past and the meaning behind the worship of noro in shrines, Kanami and Hiyori decide to join Mokusa in their mission to overthrow Origami Yukari. However, Mai finds herself wavering, unsure of her purpose. While the village is enjoying their annual festival, Yume suddenly attacks with the special military unit. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 牢監の拝謁
Audience in the Prison
Audience en prison
Roukan no Haietsu
episode.summary: With each of their missions over, Kanami and the other girls get to enjoy a rare moment together to celebrate Sayaka`s birthday. The next day, Origami Akane brings Hiyori and Akane with her as her escorts to an unusual meeting at the Ministry of Defense in Ichigaya. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怠け者の一分
Slothful Person`s Honor
Une minute de paresse
Namakemono no Ichibun
episode.summary: Kaoru is serving as captain of an expedition mission to search for an aradama in the northern Kanto region under the orders of Director Sana. Lacking motivation Kaoru leaves the search for the aradama up to her subordinates and indulges herself in some comforts. Finally, Director Sana sends in Sayaka to act as a watchdog for Kaoru to make sure the job gets done. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 家族の場景
Family Scene
Scène familiale
Kazoku no Joukei
episode.summary: Upon returning home to her family home in Minoseki, Mai is shocked when her father urges her to quit the Special Religious Military Unit. Mai struggles to make her father understand her willingness to remain a Toji. Meanwhile, when another unit is fighting to take down yet another aradama, a mysterious hooded Toji appears, steals the noro and disappears. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 次代の英雄
Hero of the Next Generation
La nouvelle génération de héros
Jidai no Eiyuu
episode.summary: It has been four months since Princess Tagitsu cut off the aradama part of herself and launched it high into the sky causing aradama to rain down all over the Kanto region in what has since been known as the Kamakura Special Hazardous Waste Leakage Problem. As a result, the frequency of aradama appearing in the Kanto region has increased and Kanami and the other girls serve on the front lines working out of the headquarters in Kamakura to try and subdue the aradama. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 胎動編 ダイジェスト
Short Version Digest
Mouvement fœtal
Taidou Hen Digest
episode.summary: A quick recap of the events and happenings in the series so far. Catch up on all that has happened over the course of the series and get ready for the second half airing in April! The journey of Kanami and the other Toji isn`t finished quite yet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の女神
The Last Goddess
La dernière déesse
Saigo no Megami
episode.summary: Being pursued, Yukari and Princess Ichikishima escape the submarine and make it to land where they find themselves confronted by the imperial guard, but manage to fend them off and continue their escape. Learning of their whereabouts, Kanami and the others follow after to try and rescue them. Before they leave on their mission, Maki pulls Kanami aside to issue a warning about Hiyori`s strange behavior. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 禍神の呼び声
Call of the Evil God
L`appel du dieu véhément
Magakami no Yobigoe
episode.summary: Kanami and the others return to headquarters feeling down and defeated after not being able to save Princess Takiri. The girls try to focus on their duties while dealing with their apprehension against Princess Tagitsu and her growing strength. Maki and Suzuka make the case that they should wait for Princess Tagitsu to make a move before they do anything. At that moment, Princess Tagitsu appears on the television. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 荒魂の跳梁
Aradama Domination
Déchaînement d`Aradama
Aradama no Chouryou
episode.summary: Chosen to be part of Princess Takiri`s defense force against Princess Tagitsu, Hiyori and Kanami once again meet with the eccentric aradama along with Akane in an attempt to get her on their side. Kanami works to make Princess Takiri understand that there is more to humans than meets the eye. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 女神たちの狂騒
The Goddesses` Madness
Tumulte entre déesses
Megami-tachi no Kyousou
episode.summary: Hiyori and Kanami continue escorting Akane, this time, as she meets with her sister onboard a submarine in the Pacific Ocean. From Yukari they learn more about the three separate entities that used to make up the great aradama that used to possess her. Meanwhile, Yukina and Yomi force the Ayanokouji president to make a tough choice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 結びの巫女
The United Maidens
La prêtresse de la fin
Musubi no Miko
episode.summary: On the day of the final battle Kanami and Hiyori disappeared into the depths of the netherworld along with Princess Tagitsu and have not been seen since. Two months have passed and the world has largely returned to normal. With their whereabouts unknown, Kanami and Hiyori wander separately through the netherworld unsure of where they are going or how much time has passed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 刹那の果て
Moment`s End
La limite de l`éphémère
Setsuna no Hate
episode.summary: The gateway to the netherworld continues to expand to the point where it has started to consume the real world. Complete demise creeps ever closer as time passes. After miraculously managing to rescue Hiyori, the girls prepare to face Princess Tagitsu with the hope and fate of the world resting on their shoulders. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 隠世の門
Gate of the Netherworld
La porte de l`au-delà
Kakuriyo no Mon
episode.summary: After absorbing Hiyori, who fused with Princess Ichikishima, Princess Tagitsu has finally obtained the complete power of the three goddesses. Upon returning to the city, Princess Tagitsu begins to open the door between this world and the netherworld. Meanwhile, Kanami and the others have been dispatched to deal with the more frequent aradama appearances. Mai and the rest of the team can tell that Kanami is pushing herself too hard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雷神の剣
Sword of the Thunder God
L`épée du dieu du tonnerre
Raijin no Ken
episode.summary: Having fused with Princess Ichikishima, Hiyori gains the power of an evil god and overwhelms Princess Tagitsu; however, she is unable to control such a vast amount of power and runs away from Kanami. Worried for her friend, Kanami reluctantly returns to report on the situation on Yukari`s instruction. Using her own experience of coexisting with the aradama, Yukari tries to help Hiyori learn to control the entities within her. Source: crunchyroll
